result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Silas M. Garland

records.addlTxt:
02:02 PM  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Silas M. Garland, appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Matter heard with Co-Defendant's Case 22CF339. Attorney Corcoran states there is no resolution at this time. Court will adjourn for reasons set forth on the record.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:16 PM
Defendant, Silas M. Garland, appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant, Silas M. Garland, appeared with Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:18 PM    Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Silas M. Garland, appeared.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Deft is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agreed to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Christopher S.

01:21 PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kelly Liebhan.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on March 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.  $2000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
